Heading: Number of victims
Value: Murdered 3 children and molested an estimated 170 children

Heading: Type of killer
Value: -Antisocial/Sociopath (psychologists described him as a 'sadistic murderer') -Mixed Lust Killer

Heading: Raised by
Value: Both parents until they divorced and then it appears he spent equal time with both of his parents

Heading: Parent’s marital status
Value: Married until he was 15 years old and then they divorced.

Heading: Problems in school?
Value: Not too bad academically, but he was a loner. He did fail his health class.

Heading: Head injury?
Value: He fell off a fence as a child (age unknown) and was knocked unconscious

Heading: Physically abused?
Value: Claims his mother hit him as a child

Heading: Psychologically abused?
Value: Dodd stated that his dad criticized a lot of what he did in school and he could never live up to his dad’s expectations. He also states that his unhappiness stemmed from his parents bickering and lack of emotional support.

Heading: Father’s occupation
Value: Dodd’s father worked at a grocery store, as a milkman and as a dairy manufacturer

Heading: Grades in school
Value: Unknown, but Dodd did say he failed his health class

Heading: Type of discharge
Value: Discharged from the Navy for 'attempting indecent liberties' on a boy.

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Worked in law enforcement?
Value: He worked as a security officer watching a construction site in Seattle, Washington, but he was fired because of trying to abduct a boy.

Heading: Types of jobs worked
Value: Security Guard, Submarine Duty, Employee at a Christian Music Camp, and worked as a Shipping Clerk

Heading: Employment status during series
Value: Working as a Shipping Clerk at Pac Paper

Heading: Been to a psychologist?
Value: Ordered to seek counseling multiple times, but had little effect

Heading: Number of victims
Value: He murdered 3 children and molested an estimated 170 children

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Method of killing
Value: Stabbed Cole and Billy Neer, suffocated Lee Iseli

Heading: Killing occurred in home of victim?
Killing occurred in home of killer?
Value: Yes- Lee Iseli was killed in Dodd’s home

Heading: Overkill?
Value: Lee Iseli, strangled him then revived him and strangled him again

Heading: Ate part of the body?
Value: Had thoughts about it, but did not get that far

Heading: Took totem – personal item
Value: Took shoelaces used to tie Neer brothers together and Lee Iseli’s underwear

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Name and state of prison
Value: Prison name unknown, but Dodd was executed in Washington
